column3: @laanwj Fixed! Looks good? Is an error message dialog necessary?
> Is an error message dialog necessary?\n\nThat's not necessary. It's fine for the export to do nothing in that case.
In normal use that shouldn't happen. However the view class should be able to work (at least: not crash) with a NULL model, for UI-only testing.

utACK fd9599b1358a314b073a9ca0a68ca8037915d91d (runtime protection is always good).\n\nThough I having a hard time finding a possibility how the user could press the "Export" button while not having a walletmodel attached to the `TransactionView`.
In case `model` or `model->getOptionsModel()` is not set, there's no reason to continue here - there's no data to export.\nMight as well return from the function early if so.
